result.execSummary:
The defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay any mandatory costs and surcharges by 2/21/2017 or civil judgment.
Court will waive all nonmandatory costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Melissa Lee Drewicz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Andrew D., Amy D.
Court sentences defendant to serve 41 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 41 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Court will waive all non-mandatory costs and surcharges due to inability to pay.  Defendant to pay any mandatory costs and surcharges by 2-21-2017 or civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 33.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in court with attorney Debra Patterson for attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

DTC - PHASE III
Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.
Court orders a $500.00 PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.
Court vacates the No contact order with L.D and modifies the NO CONTACT order with Andrew D. to incidental contact for transfer of child.

Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, REPEATER, enhancer is dismissed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  Review hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel advised court this case has been transfered to Branch 06 for Drug Treatment Court. Bail Hearing date of 7/15/2015 canceled.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 7/16/2015 at 1:30pm.  lms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.J.D. DOB 2/22/82 and his child, L.D.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Melissa Lee Drewicz in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
